case_title: COMMISSIONER OF INCOME TAX vs MUNNALAL SHRIKISHAN
reference_no_or_id: Income Tax Application No. 4 of 1987 connected with I.T.A. Nos. 12 to 19 of 1987
case_number: Income Tax Application No. 4 of 1987 connected with I.T.A. Nos. 12 to 19 of 1987
complaint_summary: The Commissioner of Income Tax filed an application challenging the Tribunal's refusal under Section 256(1) of the Income-tax Act, 1961, and raised questions regarding the calculation of interest under Section 220(2).
investigation_summary: The Tribunal had earlier refused the application under Section 256(1) of the Income-tax Act, and the Commissioner of Income Tax filed a subsequent application under Section 256(2) to seek clarification on legal questions.
judgment_summary: The court overruled the preliminary objection raised by the respondent regarding the limitation period under Section 256(2), clarifying that six months refers to calendar months. The court directed the Tribunal to state the case for the first question and submit it for the court's opinion.
legal_arguments: The respondent argued that the application was barred by limitation, citing Section 256(2) and a prior decision in CIT v. Laxmi Rattan Cotton Mills Co. Ltd.
The court clarified that the limitation period under Section 256(2) refers to six calendar months, not 180 days.
citations: CIT v. Laxmi Rattan Cotton Mills Co. Ltd. [1974] 27 ITR 285
key_issues: Interpretation of 'month' under Section 256(2) of the Income-tax Act.
Error in charging interest under Section 220(2).

preliminary_objection.raised_by: Sri B. N. Bhatnagar (Counsel for Assessee)
preliminary_objection.argument: Application filed by Commissioner of Income Tax was barred by limitation by six days under Section 256(2) of the Income-tax Act.
preliminary_objection.court_decision: Objection overruled. Six months in Section 256(2) refers to calendar months.

key_points.main_question: Whether the Hon'ble Tribunal is legally right in holding that there is an error in charging interest under Section 220(2) of the Income-tax Act, 1961?
key_points.court_direction: Income-tax Appellate Tribunal, Delhi Bench, New Delhi, directed to state the case in respect of the first question and submit it for the opinion of the court.

additional_notes.second_question: Covered by the first question; no statement required.
additional_notes.third_question: Does not arise out of the order of the Tribunal.

legal_terms.calendar month: A full month as per the calendar, not necessarily 30 days.

words_and_phrases.month: Interpreted as calendar month under Section 256(2).

summary_vector_notes: The case involved the interpretation of limitation periods under Section 256(2) of the Income-tax Act, 1961, and the calculation of interest under Section 220(2). The court clarified that six months refers to calendar months and directed the Tribunal to submit the case for the first question.
